intro: Badilloa venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan badilloa, is a flowering plant native to Venezuela. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water. The flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a cluster, contributing to its ornamental value.
